snippet: After years of Republican obstruction and obfuscation, supporters of the law are fighting back to raise enrollment.
abstract: Editorial cites new Kaiser Family Foundation poll finding that more than half of Americans say they do not know how health care reform law will affect their families; holds findings show the impact Republican obstruction and obfuscation have had on perceptions of the law; welcomes  Obama administration's public relations effort to highlight law's benefits and encourage enrollment in health insurance plans.
lead_paragraph: After years of Republican obstruction and obfuscation, supporters of the law are fighting back to raise enrollment.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
